content: lunabelle fingerless gloves amethyst mermaidesigns the lunabelle fingerless gloves are the perfect beginner project it s a simple granny square construction combined with your chosen method for joining you re sure to create the perfect pair of mitts for cooler weather - 1 terms and abbreviations us terminology beg beginning chain chain f/o fasten_off repeat repeat single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet skip skip slip_stitch slip_stitch space space st stitch rs right side ws wrong side ** indicates repeat - 2 materials needed materials needed yarn you can use any weight yarn you d like i used a bunch of cheap acrylic yarn i had in my stash hook s use the appropriate hook size for your chosen yarn weight a 5 00 mm hook was used for my sample notions scissors stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving in ends measuring tape - 3 gauge 4x4 granny square while gauge isn t crucial it s important to block and measure your first square to see if you like the size square you re getting also make sure that you re getting a uniform size you can always add or subtract row until you get your desired size - 4 let s get started make 4 - 5 - 6 note if you d like to make your mitt smaller just omit this round - 7 joining after making our basic granny squares we ll join 2 of them together so they resemble the image above you can use whatever join method you like best i like the flat single_crochet join see a tutorial here flat single crochet join - 8 flat single_crochet join 1 work single_crochet through 2 pull up long loop and insert both panels as normal to join hook into panel furthest away from you 3 wrap yarn around hook pull through 4 work single_crochet as normal only through panel closest to you repeat steps 2-4 until the end of your row repeat this process on the opposite side stopping short and leaving enough of an opening for a thumb hole - 9 ribbing both the top and bottom of our glove is worked the same join in any corner of your joined squares round 1 ch2 double_crochet evenly around join to top of ch2 with slip_stitch round 2 ch2 dcfpt dcbpt repeat to end of round join to top of ch2 with slip_stitch repeat round 2 as many times to get your desired coverage i only did once finish off and repeat on the opposite end -10 the lunabelle fingerless gloves pattern is the property of amethyst mermaidesigns please do not distribute the pattern as your own or change anything and say it is your own design you may sell any physical items made from the pattern but please use the original name and credit me as the designer permission is not given for mass production factory of any kind of this design as always thank you so much for purchasing my pattern i love to see all your
